baseline_groups.claim_summary: Mixed-race roommate assignment increases racial IAT bias for white students (reduces prejudice, positive coefficient on D-score).
baseline_groups.notes: White students: coef=0.321 (p=0.028). Residence FE, clustered at room level.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Mixed-race roommate assignment reduces racial IAT bias for black students.
baseline_groups.notes: Black students: coef=-0.095 (p=0.17). Not significant -- null effect for black students.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Mixed-race roommate assignment improves GPA for black students.
baseline_groups.notes: Black students: coef=0.272 (p=0.028). Residence + Program FE.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Mixed-race roommate assignment has no significant effect on GPA for white students.
baseline_groups.notes: White students: coef=-0.042 (p=0.86). Null as expected.

global_notes: Paper studies effects of mixed-race roommate assignment at University of Cape Town. 148 specs across many outcomes (IAT, GPA, exams, continuation, friendships, attitudes, social integration). Key findings: positive effects on black academic outcomes and white racial attitudes. Many outcomes tested -- some likely significant by chance. Placebo tests on baseline outcomes all pass.
